website_summaries.verdict: A versatile, revamped kit that's packed with features, pairs with most systems and devices, and provides crisp, clear sound.
pros: An upgraded model of a consumer favorite
Features quick-charging capability and easy to use on and off button
Earns praise for excellent sound quality

customer_reviews.title: Sound and battery are awesome
customer_reviews.text: Better upgrade than the last one its been a week still havnt charged it and my commute is about almost 2 hours a day the on off button is easy to use and a battery saver lol. Very happy with purchase
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Customer service is awesome.
customer_reviews.text: Crackling noise and stopped working after a little over a month. 10 days after the return date to be exact. *****Please note that Bella at customer service sent a new adapter immediately with apologies. I waited until I used it for several months before writing a review, if it warranted one. This one works as was advertised! Have used it daily, many times a day for over 5 months and would purchase it again. Thank you very much Bella. Your customer service is appreciated. I now will change my rating to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Reynoso

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product
customer_reviews.text: I thought that with the two usb metal adapter it was not possible to connect it near the three outputs (usb, aux, and cigarette lighter) in the place and I had to use the auxiliary cable that it brings for my 2013 elantra but it works very well, the audio It is very good, it is a good product, now I use it for everything.
customer_reviews.author: manuamazon

customer_reviews.title: Definitely a good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. I use one in my car and one in my home on my Bose speaker system. It is easy to use, is good quality materials, connects well and has pretty good sound quality.
customer_reviews.author: FranDon

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I do not understand what some negative reviews are about. The sound is very clear and loud. I just leave this connected to my auxiliary port and turn it on by flipping the switch on top and the connection is established in a second or two. When i leave the truck I turn it off. Perfect. Battery life seems very good too, i listen to it for 30 min on the way to work and same on the way back, and have not had to charge it in 4 weeks. It is a very good product, a solid purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Aalmeida

customer_reviews.title: Really reliable BT receiver, until I stupidly put it through the washing machine.  :(
customer_reviews.text: I use BT receivers with my ear protection headphones when doing yard work. This was very good because it was small, light, and connected well. Sound was good, also. I was very happy with it until I stupidly forgot to empty my pockets after mowing the lawn and washed the device in my washing machine. Now it won't connect--though it still turns on and looks for a device to connect to. Looks like I need to buy a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: xdalaw

customer_reviews.title: Finally got it! Now i'll never listen to the radio again!
customer_reviews.text: Let's just start by the fact that the BT Receiver arrived a little late, not because of amazon, but because of my freight forwarder. But, in the it arrived perfectly fine, i plugged it in right the same day it arrived to me, and i was just amazed! I'd really recommend this product to anybody who has a car with no bluetooth on the radio, sound quality's just amazing, you get to really feel it. Battery life also is amazing, i just try not to leave it on when i turn off the car. And the Material is just nice, like if you take care of it and not overcharge it, it'll last for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Luis Carlos Molina

customer_reviews.title: Amazing bluetooth receiver with /aux/ mic/ hands free/
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install an receive phone calls to listen on your own speaker , hands free, works with WhatsApp to receive calls
customer_reviews.author: luis

customer_reviews.title: Good price, good sound, good deal!
customer_reviews.text: I have to admit, I was planning on using it for my new speakers. They're wired and I wanted to go wireless. They worked perfectly. However, I bought a stronger signal one so I needed to figure out what to do with this one. In comes my sister with her new car that doesn't have Bluetooth. I plugged it into her radio's aux and played some music. Worked like a charm. Best part is she's happy and I get to listen to Tidal in her car. Win-win!
customer_reviews.author: Dragon No Rebyu

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer support
customer_reviews.text: Edit: The seller saw my original post and emailed me apologizing. Then sent me a brand new reciever. It works perfect. Glad to have my bluetooth receiver again. Original: Only lasted 3 months :( I really liked it and used it all the time. The battery life was decent. Phone calls were even good. Just one day I couldnt get it to work. It would turn on, my phone would say it's connected and playing music but I couldn't hear anything through my speakers. Switched back to my aux cord.
customer_reviews.author: KAMF08

customer_reviews.title: Reception cuts in and out - Sent me a new one and it works great!
customer_reviews.text: Regardless of whether I am using a phone on cell data or household wifi or what device I use, the reception cuts in and Original Review - Cust in and out occasionally. Range also seems to be below par. UPDATE Feb 22 - The company saw my review and sent me a new unit. Tried this one with the same setup and still cut in and out, then I changed setups, substituting an iPad for my iPhone with all other variables the same, and it worked just fine. I suspect it may be my iPhone that is causing the issue.
customer_reviews.author: S. Fryling

customer_reviews.title: Great design & great for vehicles with no Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: This is actually my second MPOW Bluetooth Receiver, which I purchased as an upgrade/replacement to my original one that I've had and used for over 4 years (the casing has started to wear out, but it still works). To my surprise, this new version is not only a much sturdier build, but the on/off is an actual physical switch, which is awesome. I loved my original, but this new one is even better, and for low the price to turn your car (as long it has an audio jack) into Bluetooth capable, you really can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Sharing Experience

customer_reviews.title: Convenient, Simple, and it Works Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I really like the design where it is plugged in and doesn't push or strain the pin down because of it's light weight as well as the ON/Off button to save battery life I'vs had mine in the car for days now and not once has the indicator light flash for me to charge it. The indicator light is also very simple to view and know if it needs to be paired, charges, and if it on or off . Really satisfied with this product and will be recommending it to friends and family members if they are in need of a Bluetooth receiver.
customer_reviews.author: Simple Man

customer_reviews.title: perfect for new iphone users without a aux jack!
customer_reviews.text: I was tired of crappy options for trying to listen to books in my car with the newer iphones, and not being able to charge at the same time. The device is perfect. I have issues with the on off switch is for me a tad backwards, but I bet most people dont turn it on or off, and I probably should start trying to go without that feature since I tend to unplug it while trying to turn it back on lol. The last two items i bought were epic fails so I am so happy there is no audio skipping or anything.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly *BookCrushin*

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!!
customer_reviews.text: I keep a charger in my car anyway, so battery life isn't a big deal to me. I LOVE this thing, especially for the cost. I used my iPhone 7 & now my iPhone XS with it. It conveys great sound. Sometimes it seems like I need to not block the signal between them (like not taking my phone out of my pocket when I'm sitting in the car). Overall, though, I'm loving it. I think I'm going to try using double-stick tape to attach it to my dash so I don't have to leave it lying on the console.
customer_reviews.author: LovnLif79

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: This thing is excellent! Works flawlessly and you definitely won’t be disappointed 💯
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Miller

customer_reviews.title: Excellent adapter even if the price was higher.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first BT adapter I bought since I'm using a Pixel 3 XL with an extended battery case that doesn't allow wired headphones through the case's port, and I love my Beats wired headphones, so this seemed to be the best option. Super easy pairing, and works very well. There is no delay in sound, and no distortion. I've even tried it in my car's Aux port, and it works great there. I only had one call through it while it was used in my car, and it went well. Overall I would say if you need a BT adapter this is a great option.
customer_reviews.author: BobbyPhoenix

customer_reviews.title: Great product, An Improvement from the Previous Version
customer_reviews.text: I had the previous version of this product for almost 3 years (pretty good for such an inexpensive unit). I never like the on/off button and how it didn't always connect the first time if I started the music on my phone before turning the unit on. This version doesn't have that problem. Plus it has a more "physical" on/off slider switch that operates much better. The charge last longer too. All in all a good purchase to allow me to stream music from my phone to the stereo in my truck.
customer_reviews.author: VARLAZY

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking
customer_reviews.text: So first here is my setup and what I was looking for. I have the SteelSeries Arctis 7. They are wireless with pc using a USB doggle. But I wanted to connect them to my Nintendo Switch. I also have the GULIKIT Route+ Bluetooth Wireless Audio Headphone Speaker Transmitter USB Type-C Adapter Transmitter and Transceiver for NS Switch. So connectinng this device to the Gulkit was simple and easy and now I have wireless sound with my Switch.
customer_reviews.author: forcie270

customer_reviews.title: Great product, works well for pretty much anything.
customer_reviews.text: Product is surprisingly small. Works very easily and is not very complicated. Battery life lasts about 12 hours on a good charge. I wouldn't recommend letting the battery drain as it will make the battery worse faster over time. Works on both iOS and Android. Comes with 3 separate cables and a mini-USB charging cable. Also comes with a metal male / male 3.5mm connector and a female / male 3.5mm connector. Large Play / Pause button on the front face. Small Volume Up / Down buttons on the side similar to a smartphone. Generous packaging and protection.
customer_reviews.author: TheGreenHelium

customer_reviews.title: Brought my car into the 21st century
customer_reviews.text: The radio in my 2007 model year car has an auxiliary audio input, but no wireless connectivity. After plugging the Mpow adapter into the auxiliary port, I can now enjoy the convenience of hands-free calling with my iPhone. I have to remember to toggle the radio to the AUX input mode to re-route the audio when answering or making a call, but that is a minor issue and not the fault of the Mpow.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Ford

customer_reviews.title: Great little Bluetooth Dongle
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I wanted and needed. It came with a micro USB charge cable and 3.5mm aux cable as well as the silver 3.5mm adapter. You can either plug it in or let it hang or adhere it someplace. Driving around for over 8 hours with this will make life easier. My older cable started shorting out. I hope to get many years with this one. I also like the fact that the metal adapter can be removed and has texture to it to get a good grip if needed.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Summerville

customer_reviews.title: Great Bluetooth Adapter
customer_reviews.text: Bought a previous version of this and if Mpow wanted to give me a trade for the newer version I'd take it! I love the physical on/off switch and the less offensive blue light on this new version. Pairs easily with my android phone and my wife's iPhone. Helps us have a bluetooth connection in our older vehicles. The battery lasts a long time and the sound quality is great. Definitely worth the price if you want bluetooth and only have a 3.5mm headphone jack in your car.
customer_reviews.author: Mr FS

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This is everything the older model needed to be. When cut on it connects almost instantly and I have no alternator feedback when audio is paused like I had in the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Works well is there no obstacles in the way.
customer_reviews.text: This product work very well while there is no obstruction in the way, I am mostly going to be using this while in the car so that won't really be a huge issue. This reciever is also able to be used at the same time as it is being charged which is a huge plus because I wanted to hook this up in my car as a permanent attachment (I don't know if this is even possible yet, I haven't tried it for the purpose yet). I used it while walking around in my house and noticed it cut out while in my pocket if my hand landed on top of the unit while it was in my pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tried them all - this one is GREAT!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 5 Bluetooth receivers/transmitters, a couple of them were FM type and returned them all because of static. This one is not. Coupled with the $8 Mpow accessory which eliminates static, this little gem has transformed my 2008 Prius into a now world automobile. I had BT in the car for the phone only but now I can listen with the aux in cable with this baby at the end. Some complained about the turning on and off button but I have no problem with that. Best part is using my speaker system in the car I can lower and turn up the volume using the car's audio system - much better than using the phone.
customer_reviews.author: plgoldsmith

customer_reviews.title: This has been a great buy
customer_reviews.text: I have an older car so it doesn't have bluetooth. I got this so I can play music through my phone. It charges quickly and the battery life is long. I will charge it about once every few weeks on my way to work. My drive is about 30 minutes, and this charge lasts for a few weeks. It connects easily to my phone and I no longer have an extra wire in my car. You can use the buttons on the side to move through songs and the larger button on the front can pause and start you songs. Really I should of gotten one of these a long time ago. I would recommend to anyone looking to buy.
customer_reviews.author: S Crow

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this unless your phone will have line-of-sight to it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to give BT connectivity to my shelf amp in my garage. I wanted to listen to music while doing projects, but keep my phone in my pocket. As soon as I get more than 6-7 feet away, or if I turn my body and get between the phone and BT receiver, the music crackles and skips. It is so annoying that I stopped using the blasted thing. I don't need it in my car but I think in a car is the only place it would work.
customer_reviews.author: XpertskiR

customer_reviews.title: Beware of faulty battery! Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: Had been using it almost daily for 10 months, then this week noticed that the plastic casing was starting to warp in the middle. I just thought maybe it had gotten knocked around in my bag. But then tonight I heard a pop and saw that the unit busted itself open. Inside I saw the tiny silver battery bulging up like a balloon. Yikes! Quickly threw the unit away because I don't want a grenade going off in my apartment. I don't know if it's just my unit or what, but beware of the battery. I don't know what would have happened if it was in my pocket and I didn't notice, ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Sarayudej

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive, works, small form factor.
customer_reviews.text: I got this along with a headphone jack-to-RCA adapter for hooking up my older stereo with bluetooth. It works and sounds decent with no lag or static. I haven't tried it from more than 5 feet of distance, but that's not an issue for me. The USB cable needed for charging didn't come with a wall adapter, and given it's smaller size I can't imagine that battery will hold up for long. This is a handy and Inexpensive solution for adding bluetooth to older stereos.
customer_reviews.author: Bones McLure

customer_reviews.title: Battery swelled up. Not good.
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for 5 months. I went to use it this morning and found that it was in two pieces. The back of it was laying next to it a few inches away from the main part. A little investigating and it was obvious that the rechargeable battery had swollen and puffed up to the point where it literally pushed the case apart. I know a thing or two about these types of batteries and can tell you that this is a fire hazard when they get like this. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: T. Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Caller on other end cannot hear. Mic problem!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wifes car. There is a big problem whenever she calls since I cant understand a word she says. I initially thought it was the phones reception but we both have Verizon in NYC and reception is never an issue. The mic on the mpow cuts off every other word she says and its impossible to understand. The adapter is located only 2ft away from her. Edit: The original product I received must have been defective. Customer service sent a replacement and it works perfectly fine. Great customer service
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Mic doesn't work well, loud screeching
customer_reviews.text: It seems to work except when making calls. The people on the other side are hearing a loud screeching sound. I even tried to use another aux cord but it still happens. I've had another brands bluetooth receiver without this issue. Not sure if everyone has this issue or if it's just a defective device.
customer_reviews.author: Mandy

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I've got hardwired speakers in a golf cart and this allows me to listen to phone music and radio via bluetooth. It connects pretty fast and works fine. The only thing is sometimes volume control is a little shaky. For instance if I am trying to turn vol down low to (when playing golf with other people) it won't allow me to go low enough for my desires and other times it will. Not a big deal and I enjoy listening to my music while playing. Problem was after changing from one iPhone to another the plug and play went away and I just have bluetooth now. Problem solved.
customer_reviews.author: SteveTex

customer_reviews.title: Older Radio now bluetooth connected
customer_reviews.text: I downsized vehicles and my previous SUV had BT so instantly connected my phone and could listen to Spotify now I'm using my older 2011 Camry and with this adapter I can connect my phone and listen to my music again. It worked flawless from the get go, is a little different now that is not automatic like my previous car but it works really well. Make sure you press the switch to turn OFF when you get out of the car at least I do, haven't needed to charge it yet but that maybe due to not driving as much anymore since 99% you r at home these days.
customer_reviews.author: rquiles

customer_reviews.title: With A Direct Line Of Sight It’s Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great for playing video games or watching movies because there is zero perceivable delay! (The lips actually light up with the dialog.) If you don’t have a reasonably clear line of sight between your phone and the device you may have intermittent cutout of the audio. Hasn’t really been much of a problem for me. I’ve only used it a couple times and the first time the battery lasted at least 12 hours—probably longer. The second time it lasted slightly less time but I may not have recharged it 100%. I really feel I got the best one of these available for the price.
customer_reviews.author: JJL

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: This Bluetooth aux is far better than the Monster Bluetooth I bought at Walmart. I love the toggle on and off switch and the battery last about 8 hours, give or take! Extremely satisfied and highly recommend. I have an iPhone and automatically plays your last playlist on Spotify just by tapping into the app. The play and pause button feature on the device itself is fantastic and doesn’t lose its place in your music even if you walk away from your car and/or turn it off and back on again.
customer_reviews.author: Mister Stark

customer_reviews.title: Nope.
customer_reviews.text: So, I bought this and it worked fine at first - easy set up and good sound quality. I have a Bose system in my car and it seemed to sound great to me. However, it's been 34 days (just over the return window, so I cannot return it now) and there is a terrible crackling... the only way to stop it is to hold it in place... not very good for when you're driving. Sadly - I won't be using this anymore. Good concept, but poor quality. My advice - spend a little more and get something better, I know I will be doing that.
customer_reviews.author: Estarr1218

customer_reviews.title: I'm going to give it soild four star
customer_reviews.text: Minus one star for audio delay time to time, little annoying volume control cause i have to long press button to change the volume which I see why they made that way but personally found it to be so annoying and last reason is little lack sound quality in mid tone. by the way I'm really sensitive person but bass is awesome though just like it's corded. This is so much better than my 2 years old taotronic receiver in terms of sound quality. update: extremely weak connectivity. returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Sun kyu, Choi

customer_reviews.title: Awesome WiFi receiver and adapter!
customer_reviews.text: It converted my first generation Bose Wave Radio into a wireless connected device! The sound quality is pristine and only depends on the source you're streaming from. I just got and after I charged it, the setup took no more than 3 minutes. I definitively recommend this product to upgrade your non blue tooth devices into wireless. I cannot speak for the battery duration yet, but since you can run it while charging, it should not be an issue. It's an awesome value for your money.
customer_reviews.author: Guillermo Marquez

customer_reviews.title: Product only lasts for two months...
customer_reviews.text: This product worked great for about two months. The issues I’m having are the the Bluetooth connection drops every few seconds and ruins the song. My phone and the Bluetooth receiver don’t move while they’re in my car so I don’t understand why I’m losing the connection. The audio is also horrible because the Bluetooth receiver has a lot of static noise when driving, I have to constantly deal with static noise and the drop of connection when I use this product. Beware of this product because I’m out of the return window and I’m stuck with something that I can’t fully enjoy.
customer_reviews.author: R. Navarrete

customer_reviews.title: Pretty satisfied
customer_reviews.text: It does the intended job and more just not as well as I'd hope. The sound quality isn't quite as good as built-in Bluetooth headphones and range is terrible. It will occasionally make a few pops/crackels when moving around. All said it's still pretty crazy turning any wired headphones into Bluetooth capable ones. It comes with the tiny male to male aux adapter show in the photos which is great for cars or headphones with removable aux cables. It also came with a decent male to male aux cable and a usb charger so it's a pretty good deal. The battery life is looking to be as described as well with it at 90% after hours of use so far.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: An Affordable Way to Add Bluetooth to Your Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: I have an older van without Bluetooth. Due to the iPhone's lack of a headphone jack, charging and listening are not its strong suit. The Lighting port split dongles to offer charging and a headphone jack simply aren't reliable. I have tried a few and they all eventually failed or stopped working well. This, however, has worked very well since I got it. It works reliably, it seems to remember multiple devices for easy connections from different phones, and the sound quality is great! This is a great option to add Bluetooth for a cheap no-risk price.
customer_reviews.author: Annie Bananie

customer_reviews.title: Like most Bluetooth devices
customer_reviews.text: This receiver had poor sound quality but it also has no range and/or caused static when connected to my Echo Plus. Was returned. UPDATED: From 1 star to 4, Mpow sent me a FREE replacement after refunding my return. The new unit does not have the static and the range and sound quality is basic Bluetooth (just not great). The Echo Plus, on the other hand, is a joke as nothing other than Amazon's (poor quality) Music stream service works properly with these devices. There is simply NO other way to group these speakers!
customer_reviews.author: Rick Medugno

customer_reviews.title: Quick to connect. Poor range.
customer_reviews.text: Quick to connect. Easy to use. Bluetooth 5.0 is supposed to have vastly improved range. If you move more than 10 feet from the receiver in the same room with a clear line of sight, you will begin to lose signal. Either it is not true 5.0 or it is terrible hardware. My 4 year old beat to a pulp Cambridge works BT speaker rocking BT3.0 gets you at least 25 ft of distance before getting broken up. It is really disappointing as my receiver sits on a 3 seasons room with indoor and outdoor speakers. I was really hoping to be able to walk around the deck without it cutting out.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: All it takes is once
customer_reviews.text: Coming up on a year of owning this product. Up until 2 months ago it was great, perfect for what I needed. The battery life was insane that I would be confused when it made the beeping noise to charge. But like I said, it was great All it takes is one time to accidentally over charge it and the thing demands the cord 24/7. Before I could charge this, my headphones, or neither and be fine. Now when my headphones need a quick charge I have to blast music through my phone's speakers. Should you get it, absolutely Should you pay attention to the time you charge it, ABSOLUTELY.
customer_reviews.author: grant

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: What a great value for this little thing. It really transforms your car as if it had a built-in bluetooth feature! It's great for older cars that may not be so "high-tech" but still has a aux port. I own an iPhone and it recognized it quickly. Just like new models of cars, that bluetooth automatically connects and works well with other apps. very well pleased with it. Can withstand the heat of the Las Vegas summers in the car...if it can do that, then it can withstand any other temperature! What a great BARGAIN!! I am so pleased. You can charge it, and the battery life reaches a good amount of time, too. Definitely worth that purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Macy Dizon

customer_reviews.title: An easy way to add Bluetooth Connectivity to old gear!
customer_reviews.text: I've had a few of these mPow bluetooth receivers and this one has been like the other: great! After a few hours of changing, boom! Plugged into the aux input on my 5 year old city-car and both Android and iOS phones were able to connect in a flash. I was talking through the car, streaming Spotify, etc. Lasted about a week before needing to be charged. I know it's not complicated tech, but it's a great little piece of kit to have to allow our mobile devices to work in a wider level of environments. I always have one handy...!
customer_reviews.author: J. Olin

customer_reviews.title: Works as intended.  Easy to break.
customer_reviews.text: Just as the title says. It works perfectly. The audio quality is typical bluetooth. The build quality is what you'd expect from the price, but for regular use it should hold up. It sticks out of my stereo if I connect it directly and someone bumping into it would definitely break it. As such, I plan to connect it using an aux cable and velcro the device somewhere reachable. I find that I do have to turn it on, then off and back on again sometimes to get it to recognize my iPhone 11 but this works consistently so I don't mind lol.
customer_reviews.author: Sabbatai

customer_reviews.title: Sounds Good when not chirping.
customer_reviews.text: This transmitter works great but out of the blue it will begin chirping. I've tried numerous things to figure out why but no reasoning. It's not 100% but usually I have to turn it completely off, reconnect it all and hold the power button to reset it. Sometimes multiple times? After 30 minutes of off/on, etc. it'll start working again.
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: FORGET WIRELESS BLUETOOTH HEADPHONES JUST BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: use ANY desired plug in headphones with a standard headphone jack and connect to this little 14.99 usd treasure, makes any wired headphones wireless bluetooth 5.0 headphones and it lasts for 12 HOURS whereas most bluetooth wireless headphones cost 35+ dollars to last 5-6 hours. the charge time on this thing is 45 mins vs for most bluetooth wireless headphones its at least 1 hour. you can make it charge faster with premium micro usb cable and quick charge 3.0 usb adapter plug. best part is that it is small and will fit into the small coin pocket in most jeans. will buy again. forget those wireless bluetooth headphones, this is where it's at!
customer_reviews.author: farmerroxas

customer_reviews.title: Poorly made. Ruined my aux port. So lame.
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy! Worked fine for a couple of months, but the problem now is a big one. It seems the headphone connection part is two parts. One of the parts is now stuck inside my car's aux port, not broke off but separated (there is no broken edge). I don't think they make pliers small enough to pull it out either, so it has effectively ruined my aux port and I don't have Bluetooth in that car. So lame. Why make that part two pieces?
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I love this Bluetooth audio connector. I use it in my car where I connect my aux cord. I have a iPhone X and my car is not Bluetooth so when I was having trouble with listening to music and charging my phone at the same time. I either had to pick one or the other. I was going to buy a Bluetooth radio but boy I’m glad I didn’t cause this works perfectly and is a small fraction of the price as a Bluetooth radio. The audio sound is great through it. I have no problem ever connecting. When it goes in sleep mode though you just have to press the play/pause button to wake it up.
customer_reviews.author: Erica

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade for older cars
customer_reviews.text: My 2009 Altima has Bluetooth, but it only works for phone calls. I was tired of having to plug it up to my aux every time I wanted to listen to music. This was the perfect solution. I just hop in the car, flip the switch to turn this one, and it connects to my phone right away. The only con is that you have to charge it, but that's understandable. It has to get power some way. You don't have to charge it often though. I often forget to turn the device off when I get out of the car and it still stays charged for weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing substitute for an AUX cord
customer_reviews.text: It's simple and easy to use. I just connect it to my phone and turn it on and off when I get in and out of my car and it automatically connects to my phone. I notice no difference in quality for the music compared to using AUX and the battery lasts on average a little under a month for using it about an hour a day for driving home and to work so you don't need to worry about bringing it inside to charge often.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.author: Selma

customer_reviews.title: It's worth what I paid for sure

It has definitely paid for itself in my case. It comes with a cable and plug giving you the choice that works best for you. It's a great item!

It connects quickly every time and I've tried using it unplugged until the battery died and got tired of keeping track of time. That means it's got good battery life. The only issue is it does a weird thing with the sound compared to being plugged in with a 3.5mm jack. The lows are dampened, and the highs are harsher. But that's par for the course with a device of this price point.

customer_reviews.author: adriana salinas

customer_reviews.title: Decreased quality of sound.
customer_reviews.text: The Bluetooth works but the quality of sound is decreased. It gets worse when there is something in between the small device and what its connected to. It can by anything or anyone. A person passing in between interrupts the connectivity. When I connect it to my computer which is at the bottom of table, and I place the small stereo with the device connected, the sound quality sounds muffled. And that's only 2 feet apart with a table in between. I'm surprise this thing has high praises with almost 5 stars. Either its only my device or most consumer has low taste for good quality sound.
customer_reviews.author: Jocyl

customer_reviews.title: great value, BUT...
customer_reviews.text: **update 11 months after purchase: battery swelled up causing the top cover to pop. I had to clip off the battery and take it to a recycle center before it would catch my car on fire. Decreased rating from 4 to 3 stars. Very good device otherwise but quite concerned about battery safety. __________ connectivity is very quick. sound quality is great except that it sometimes clips loud music causing distortion. aside from that, a great buy.
customer_reviews.author: alex

customer_reviews.title: no right channel audio most of the time with included adapter
customer_reviews.text: Like: inexpensive. Easy bluetooth pairing. Battery life pretty good. Easy charging. It turns itself off nicely after my phone goes out of range so that it saves battery. Turning it back on is easy. Didn't like: mini jack doesn't have right channel audio most of the time. With nearly all plugs, including the plug-to-plug adapter that comes with the unit, there is no right channel audio going out. Every once in a while, when I fiddle with the jack, I hear a little audio. When I plug in my headphones, they seem to get audio just fine on both channels, but most of the time, with other cables, no-go.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hargrove

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised
customer_reviews.text: We bought a little run around car that isn't bluetooth capable so after not having Pandora and listening to live radio and these DJs that think they are the funniest and most clever things on earth..but i digest......hooked this little baby up not expecting much and low and behold, it works like a champ. customer_reviews.author: HiThere

The music between sets is usually fairly quiet so I am not terribly concerned about sound quality but it seems just fine. For the price, its a great buy I recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Guenther

customer_reviews.title: Works great!

There is a very quiet hiss when no audio is playing and the device is charging, but as long as audio is playing, you can't hear the hiss. It connects as soon as the car turns on, and automatically turns off when I leave the vehicle, works great!
customer_reviews.author: donna j.

customer_reviews.title: Connectivity is okay...

The issues is when I have my phone in my pocket, when moving around even 10 feet away it would have static or loose connection. Overall if you have your phone in one spot this product will work great as advertise, but for my case having my phone in my pocket and moving around will create issues.

product_meta.title: Mpow BH129 Bluetooth Receiver for Car, Aux Bluetooth Car Adapter 5.0 for Wired Speakers/Headphones/Home Music Streaming Stereo,15-Hour Battery Life,Easy Control On/Off Slider, Built-in Microphone
product_meta.description:
Color:BlackQ1: What is the Function of a Bluetooth Receiver? 
A1: It's for enabling Bluetooth function on non-Bluetooth car/speaker/earphones so you can enjoy wireless music from a smartphone. 

Pairing Steps: 
1. Plug Mpow BH129 into your non-Bluetooth car/speaker's 3. 5mm aux port 
2. Power on Mpow BH129 Bluetooth receiver 
3. Enable Bluetooth on your phone, search and connect to "BH129"
4. After connecting Mpow with your phone, start to enjoy wireless music 
5. NOTE: If you want to transfer the audio signal to your Bluetooth Devices like Bluetooth Headsets/speakers from TV/PC, you could search and connect Mpow Bluetooth Transmitter on those devices. 

Q2: How to charge Mpow 129? Can I use it while charging? 
A2: 1. Charge with the equipped micro USB charging cable. After fully charged, the indicator light would turn off. 
2. BH129 also could be used while charging, however, there might be some current noises and a ground loop noise isolator would remove it. 

Q3: Does it turn off automatically after being disconnected for a while? 
A3: 1. When BH129 is left not streaming for 10 minutes, it will automatically enter sleeping mode with the indicator lights off to save power; then if you want to reconnect BH129 please short press any button to active paring mode with the indicator flashing blue and red alternately. 
2. NOTE: If you want to turn BH129 off, please turn it off manually. 
3. NOTE: It would not turn on automatically even at the Sleeping Mode. 

Q4: Why Mpow BH129 Bluetooth Receiver could not auto re-connect to my phone? 
A4: 1. Mpow could auto re-connect to the LAST paired Bluetooth device after rebooting. 
2. NOTE: If your BH129 is in sleeping mode, you need to wake it by pressing any button to active paring mode with the indicator flashing blue and red alternately. 
3. NOTE: If you turn off the Bluetooth on your phone last time connected to BH129, it requires manually connecting BH129 on your phone.
feature_bullets: MPOW FLAGSHIP BLUETOOTH 5. 0 ADAPTER: Designed perfect for non-Bluetooth car/home stereo system with 3 5mm aux port to be Bluetooth enabled (If you want to connect to TV by pairing Mpow with Bluetooth headsets please search Mpow Bluetooth Transmitter ).

CSR CHIP FOR CD-LIKE MUSIC FEAST: Adopted CSR chip for providing more stable and faster transmission with less power consumption which can represent a superior audio performance to spoil your ear and never feeling boring while driving.
BUILT-IN MIC FOR SPEAKERPHONE CALLS: Just press the answer button to answer or hang up your phone calls while driving (If you use Mpow-129 with wired headphones please answer with your headphones ).

DUAL LINK FOR MORE CHOICE: Mpow can connect 2 Bluetooth devices at the same time for enjoying your music and won't miss any calls Or enjoy music and navigation at the same time 15 HOURS long battery life and also supports playing while charging.

1 SECOND SWITCHING BUTTON: Mpow Bluetooth car aux adapter designed with PHYSICAL ON/OFF SWITCH & HUMANIZED WIDENED VOLUME/TRACK BUTTON on the side for quick and convenient control for your hands-release talking and listening experience.

WIDE COMPATIBILITY RECEIVER: Stream stereo music wirelessly through most home audio systems car stereo system and wired headphones from Bluetooth enabled devices like smartphones tablets MP3 players etc (HFP/HSP/A2DP/AVRCP).
